flow.descriptionCdata:
635a01e7-0cbf-4b0f-9367-d5c8b66f50f2.1e63a922-7b69-4061-96f6-e46699706c99.description=generates a random password consisting og lowercase letters, uppercase letter and number Inputs\: passwordLength - specifies length of the password to be generated Outputs\: generatedPassword - the generated password string 635a01e7-0cbf-4b0f-9367-d5c8b66f50f2.1e8ee213-28a3-4674-803b-b96e7bc34600.description=
Scan opened ports on give host  

Inputs\: 
 host - IP address Host name to be scanned
 lowestPort - lowest port range
 highestPort - highest port range
 portType - the type of ports to be scanned (TCP or UDP). If not specified, the TCP ports are scanned.

Note\:
 To scan specific port give same port as parameter for both Lowest Port and Highest Port, 

Responses\:
 success - the command was executed successfully
 failure - the command could not be executed

Result\:
 finalResult - Information about the ports' statuses on a given machine.

Extra results\:
 host - the IP of the host for which the ports are scanned
 ports - Number of ports scanned
 opened - Number of ports open
 closed - Number of ports closed
 dropped - Number of ports dropped
635a01e7-0cbf-4b0f-9367-d5c8b66f50f2.2a855a2f-a885-4533-a3d7-e0ceb3d39f54.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
635a01e7-0cbf-4b0f-9367-d5c8b66f50f2.3d150c4c-0d32-490a-9078-8bec8cdc9559.description=
This is an operation that does nothing, and can be used to display information to the user by editing the display tab. It can also be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs, and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
635a01e7-0cbf-4b0f-9367-d5c8b66f50f2.46294072-b997-493e-b8eb-5ea10b954a26.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
635a01e7-0cbf-4b0f-9367-d5c8b66f50f2.4bb5ad99-6125-4bcb-a591-eac3e2ba2891.description=Sleeps for "X" seconds. 
Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for "X" seconds.
failure - was unable to sleep for some reason
635a01e7-0cbf-4b0f-9367-d5c8b66f50f2.af33532c-1685-4e54-8df1-88de732ed389.description=
Runs a command and allows user to specify that it runs locally (in this case no port should be specified), via ssh, Global Shell, ROSH, Telnet, or RSH.

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address.
port - Port number for connecting to the host.
username - Username to connect as.
password - Password of the user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
protocol - The protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, REXEC, local, WMI, NASConnectTelnet, or HPOM).
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete; increase its value if you are getting incomplete output results or timeout.
command - The command to execute.
arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
environment - Specifies environment variables/values that need to be defined when running command.
startDir - The path to the starting directory.
pty - Whether to use pty (used by ssh, GlobalShell. Valid values\: true, false).
privateKeyFile - Path to private key file, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on RAS host (used by ssh, GlobalShell).
sasHost - The host we want to run the ROSH command on.
sasHostUsername - The username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost.
usernamePrompt - The prompt that when seen should send the username; used by the Telnet protocol; when used by the NASConnectTelnet protocol, the default value is 'NAS Login\:'
passwordPrompt - The prompt that when given should send the password; used by the Telnet protocol; when used by the NASConnectTelnet protocol, the default value is 'Password\:'
outputPath - Network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default, the path will have to be  changed on Windows 2000 systems
nasDevice - The NAS device to run the command on when using the NASConnect protocol.
nasDeviceConsoleMode - The NAS device console mode used to run the command scripts that run the command on the given NAS device. If this input is empty, command scripts are not used, and the connection to the NAS device and the command are issued directly in the console; this is not recommended, since its error handling capabilities are limited and it might result in success even when the command fails to execute. The values for this input can be found in the NAS web interface, as a drop-down list when a new command script is created (ex. Cisco IOS enable).
hpomNode - Node on which the command is to be executed.
hpomProtocol - Protocol to communicate with HPOM (http or https).
characterSet - The characterSet name for stream encoding and decoding between the RAS and target machine. For example, SJIS,EUC-JP, UTF-8.  By default it is UTF-8 (used by ssh, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, REXEC).

Responses\:
success - The command was executed successfully.
failure - The command could not be executed.

Extra Results\:
stdErr - The STDERR of the command.
stdOut - The STDOUT of the command.

Notes\:
Telnet protocol - Since telnet is not a remote execution protocol but a shell protocol the response will always be successful if the command was executed in the remote shell.  The return code of the specified command cannot be determined in this protocol.  If you must use the telnet protocol with this operation besure to check the command results. Consider using ssh or rexec protocol instead.
635a01e7-0cbf-4b0f-9367-d5c8b66f50f2.b0283cbf-5aa7-4038-b9b9-45b10e5c17d6.description=Counts from one number to another number. 
Inputs\:
count - number of loops to complete
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from the beginning.

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Responses\:
has more - Not yet done counting.
no more - Done counting. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure - Something went wrong.
635a01e7-0cbf-4b0f-9367-d5c8b66f50f2.ddcab576-9e47-41de-9c9e-ac13e18bd169.description=
This is an operation that does nothing, and can be used to display information to the user by editing the display tab. It can also be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs, and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
flow.name: LINUX_SetupDefaultAdmin

scriptlet.name: default
